title: G4MF Mesh Surface
description: A mesh surface is a collection of vertices, edges, and polytopes that define a part of a mesh. Each surface may have a material.

edges.description: The index of the accessor that contains the edge indices for this surface. Each component in the accessor is an index of a vertex in the mesh's vertices accessor, and MUST NOT exceed the bounds of the mesh's vertices accessor. If not defined, the surface does not have explicit edges, but edges may be calculated from the simplex cells if needed. If defined, may be used as the foundation of the data in `topology`.

material.description: The index of the material used by this surface. This references a material defined in the G4MF document-level `materials` array. If not defined, the surface should use a default material.

normals.description: The index of the accessor that contains the per-vertex-instance normals for this surface. If not defined, flat shading is assumed, meaning that all vertex instances in a simplex cell have the same normal as the simplex cell itself.

polytopeSimplexes.description: If true, allow importing the simplex data as complex polytopes instead of individual simplex cells. Each polytope is defined by a set of consecutive simplexes that share the same starting vertex index. If not specified, the default is false.

simplexes.description: The index of the accessor that contains the simplex cell indices for this surface. Each component in the accessor is an index of a vertex in the mesh's vertices accessor, and MUST NOT exceed the bounds of the mesh's vertices accessor. If not defined, the surface does not have explicit simplex cells, and may be a wireframe-only surface, or may be calculated from the geometry data if needed.

textureMap.description: The index of the accessor that contains the per-vertex-instance texture map data for the mesh surface's vertex instances. A texture map, also known as a UV map or UVW map, is a mapping from the vertex instances to the texture coordinates. The accessor MUST have a floating-point component type, and values are usually on a range of 0.0 to 1.0. The accessor MUST have its vector size set to the dimension of the texture space.
